system.description:
Using further reinforcements to the leather through the application of studs, rings, or other metal pieces strengthens it against slashes and cuts.

Full armor adds gauntlets to protect the hands, vambraces for the forearms, chausses for the legs, a closed helm that protects the face, and perhaps additional pieces for the throat, elbows, and knees. Full armor also often includes a gambeson, a heavily padded surcoat worn over the armor.
